faq.question: How do I book an appointment?
faq.answer: You can book online through our website 24/7, call us on 0490348227 during business hours, or send us a message on social media.

faq.question: What is your cancellation policy?
faq.answer: We require 24 hours notice for cancellations or rescheduling. Late cancellations may incur a fee. We understand emergencies happen and will always work with you.

faq.question: Do you offer free consultations?
faq.answer: Yes! We offer complimentary consultations for all our services. This helps us understand your needs and provide an accurate quote.

faq.question: What areas do you service?
faq.answer: We primarily service Melbourne, Melbourne, and surrounding areas within QLD. Contact us to confirm we cover your location.

faq.question: Is parking available?
faq.answer: Yes! Free parking is available near our location. There's also street parking and public transport options nearby.

faq.question: What payment methods do you accept?
faq.answer: We accept all major credit cards, EFTPOS, bank transfer, and cash. Payment plans may be available for larger services.

faq.question: Are you licensed and insured?
faq.answer: Yes, we are fully licensed and insured. All our team members hold current certifications and undergo regular training.

faq.question: Do you offer warranties on your work?
faq.answer: Yes! We stand behind our work with satisfaction guarantees and warranties on applicable services. Ask us for details.

about.title: Melbourne's Most Trusted Ndis Since 2021
about.story: Richard School NDIS Service for Autistic is a Melbourne-based specialist disability support provider dedicated to empowering autistic individuals through person-centered, evidence-based services. Founded on the principle that every autistic person deserves respect, understanding, and the opportunity to thrive, we deliver comprehensive NDIS supports that honor neurodiversity while building practical skills for independent living. Our experienced team of qualified support workers, therapists, and plan managers work collaboratively with participants, families, and other professionals to create meaningful outcomes aligned with individual goals and aspirations. We understand that autism presents differently for each person, which is why our services are highly individualized and responsive to unique strengths, challenges, and preferences. At Richard School NDIS Service for Autistic, we're committed to creating inclusive communities where autistic individuals can participate fully, develop their potential, and live fulfilling lives with dignity and choice.
about.mission: Our mission is to deliver exceptional ndis services in a welcoming environment, using sustainable practices and premium products.
